715121f-b.title: Manhattan: 116th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715121f-b.text:
(1)
East 116th Street, east of Pleasant Ave., to the Harlem River.
Also shown is the Ferry to Wards Island.
September 17, 1935.
P. L. SPerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, slightly closer.
Septmber 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715123f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715123f-a.text:
East 116th Street, east of Pleasant Ave.; this is the north side of the street.
September 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715122f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715122f-a.text:
East 116th Street, east from Pleasant Ave. to the Harlem River, showing
at the latter the ferry house and slip of the Ferry to Wards Island (seen
in the background). Upon the lIsland are portions of two bridge structures:
The Triborough and the New York Central Railroad (Hell Gate).
October 6, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

715124f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715124f-a.text:
454 East 116th Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Pleasant Ave.
Building shown, is a frame structure.
July 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715125f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715125f-a.text:
450-448 East 116th Street, south side, west of Pleasant Ave. Shown
is the Rectory of the R.C. Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel (449 East 115th
Street).
July 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

731609f-a.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731609f-a.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Parade, on 116th Street, passing
the N.W. corner of Fleasant Avenue.
July 16, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view.
July 16, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
